item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Friday, October 25, 2024 at 1:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Quantized Llama models with increased speed and a reduced memory footprint (246 points | 56 comments)
2. Why Safety Profiles Failed (81 points | 34 comments)
3. Launch HN: Skyvern (YC S23) – open-source AI agent for browser automations (230 points | 52 comments)
4. Bitwarden SDK relicensed from proprietary to GPLv3 (39 points | 7 comments)
5. Security research on Private Cloud Compute (171 points | 45 comments)
6. Brush – A new compatible Gaussian splatting engine (89 points | 18 comments)
7. Zigler: Zig NIFs in Elixir (133 points | 48 comments)
8. Never Missing the Train Again (160 points | 52 comments)
9. Post World War II Food (145 points | 109 comments)
10. Show HN: 2048 turned 10 this year, I built an updated version to celebrate (424 points | 163 comments)
11. Show HN: TypeSchema – A JSON specification to describe data models (70 points | 28 comments)
12. Lingo: A Go micro language framework for building Domain Specific Languages (45 points | 12 comments)
13. Show HN: Pneumatic – free open-source workflow software (7 points | discuss)
14. Viva Labs (YC W22) is hiring a video/image AI research lead ( | hide)
15. The Lion of St. Mark's Square in Venice Is Chinese (95 points | 35 comments)
16. Data viz project that maps all earthquakes by magnitude (48 points | 8 comments)
17. U.S. Consumer Watchdog Cautions Businesses on Surveillance of Workers (19 points | 4 comments)
18. The Anvil Text Editor (79 points | 66 comments)
19. Rider is now free for non-commercial use (636 points | 313 comments)
20. Working with Igalia to Improve RISC-V LLVM Continuous Integration (15 points | 4 comments)
21. Self-Documenting Code (44 points | 88 comments)
22. Riot Games: Peeking into Valorant's Netcode (2020) (124 points | 52 comments)
23. BYD EV teardown in Japan reveals secrets to its affordability (76 points | 144 comments)
24. When Samsung meets MediaTek: the story of a small bug chain [pdf] (3 points | 1 comment)
25. ST Book, the Notebook Atari ST – By Paul Lefebvre (6 points | discuss)
26. LibLISA – Instruction Discovery and Analysis on x86-64 (33 points | 4 comments)
27. Show HN: Desktop Sandbox for Secure Cloud Computer Use (38 points | 2 comments)
28. Show HN: RF Hunter – Find hidden cameras and other devices (430 points | 133 comments)
29. Why did you write a new RTOS for CHERIoT? (39 points | 9 comments)
30. Dynamic Models of Gentrification (33 points | 19 comments)
